body:
## Problem:
Users/plugins may want to use the config definition without actually activating the config via setup(). https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/pull/3330#issuecomment-2387285872

## Solution:
- Expose `config_def` field and document it.
- Also undeprecate some stuff that doesn't yet have a documented alternative.

---

TODO: configs.lua sets `M.filetypes = config.filetypes` and other fields in ad-hoc fashion "for :LspInfo" but it's not clear when those fields are actually populated, and they don't source from `config_def`...

comment_data.body: It's not clear why these fields don't merge the info from `config_def`. @glepnir do you know?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -178,7 +181,7 @@ function configs.__newindex(t, config_name, config_def)
       end)
     end
 
-    -- Used by :LspInfo
+    -- Used by :LspInfo (evil, mutable aliases?)
     M.get_root_dir = get_root_dir
     M.filetypes = config.filetypes
     M.handlers = config.handlers

comment_data.body: should be merged with user config.  looks like a mistake here.  but the handlers are no longer managed by lspconfig. So it is useless.

comment_data.body:
see https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/master/lua/lspconfig/configs/denols.lua

we suggest use vim.lsp.handlers[method] = xxx, but lspinfo can not capture this override.

comment_data.body:
I'm trying to understand:

> handlers are no longer managed by lspconfig

in the denols.lua config you linked, I still see `config.handlers` being assigned.

comment_data.body:
More like a bridge. It passes to vim.lsp.handlers via config. lspconfig should not do this. It is better to use vim.lsp.handlers directly in server config. if we want show the override just do it in checkhealth .

there only `jdtls eslint denols relay_lsp koka grammarly` use config.handlers.

comment_data.body: could you create an issue (or PR to lspconfig.txt) that describes how users / config authors can do that to migrate their `lspconfig.handlers` ?

comment_data.body:
```diff
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/health.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/health.lua
index 18066a84d..faf43ddcd 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/health.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/health.lua
@@ -159,6 +159,16 @@ local function check_position_encodings()
   end
 end

+function M.check_handlers_override()
+  local handlers = vim.lsp.handlers
+  for name, handler in ipairs(handlers) do
+    local source = debug.getinfo(handler, 'S').source
+    if not source:find('vim/lsp/handlers.lua') then
+      report_info(('Handler of method %s override in: %s '):format(name, source))
+    end
+  end
+end
+
 --- Performs a healthcheck for LSP
 function M.check()
   check_log()

```

an example which improve our checkhealth of vim.lsp to show the override handlers location. then we don't need to show it in lspinfo .this way is more like we want.

title: feat: expose config definition as `config_def`
